title: Anders Behring Breivik
summary: Fjotolf Hansen[5] (born 13 February 1979), better known by his former name Anders Behring Breivik (Norwegian pronunciation: [ˈɑ̂nːəʂ ˈbêːrɪŋ ˈbræ̂ɪviːk] (listen))[6] and by his pseudonym Andrew Berwick, is a Norwegian far-right domestic terrorist[7] who committed the 2011 Norway attacks on 22 July 2011. On that day, he killed eight people by detonating a van bomb at Regjeringskvartalet in Oslo, then killed 69 participants of a Workers' Youth League (AUF) summer camp in a mass shooting on the island of Utøya — the most fatalities by a single gunman.[8][9]
